data.title: Very nice experience
data.text: I went to see a movie.  Lines were a bit long, but they sped right thru.  Seats in theatre are nice and comfortable and staff is helpfull.  Snack bar prices are average but there are some decent deals.

data.title: Nice modern and clean theater.
data.text: It's located in what appears to be a rejuvenated older section of town.  We had used tripadvisor to check for movie theaters near our motel and decided on the Maya theater.  Better still, it was Wednesday and the $4 ticket price was in effect for seniors!  We got to watch the movie "Sully."  Good movie in a comfortable theater.  The padded seats recline slightly for comfort.   So if you're a senior, and it's Wednesday night, go watch a movie here.  No crowds, and $4 tickets.  You have 14 screens to chose from.

data.title: Weekly night out
data.text: Maya Cinemas is very close to my home and we usually make it a point to go there at least once a week or when a desirable new movie comes out. It's in the heart of Old Town Salinas so you can easily make it a "dinner and a movie" outing as there are several restaurants and drinking establishments in the immediate vicinity. It usually pretty clean and they have validated parking.

data.title: In need of an update
data.text:
This is the first new, state of the art movie theater built in this part of Salinas in decades. Needless to say, in 2005, it opened to very enthusiastic crowds. Many screens, large and small, great sound system, and even some 3-D and motion type seats have allowed it to stay competitive.
But the carpets are old and nasty...some of the seats need cleaning. It's not horrible, just in need of a little update.
What bothers me most is the absolute sloppiness of many of the patrons. Popcorn is literally dumped on the floor. Nachos with all the goop are left sitting on the seats, which fold up and...yuck. 
Maybe I went on a bad night, maybe because school was just out, maybe....but it could have been better.

data.title: Affordable, Spacious, and...Did I Mention Popcorn with Tapatio, Jalapenos, and Lime?
data.text: Affordable, Spacious, and...Did I Mention Popcorn with Tapatio, Jalapenos, and Lime? In the era of homogeneous, and at times, dare I say,"soul-less", corporate dominated establishments-Maya Cinemas is truly Unique! Upon arrival, you'll notice affordable ticket prices (at least your pocket will), large theaters, and throw back movie days where one can enjoy and/or share in classic films produced before the era of cookie-cutter/over-stimulating/tasteless films forced down our throats via mass media.

data.title: Family Fun Adventure!
data.text: The ticket booth was simple and quick, entering the theater was nice the ticket taker told all of us what theater and location our movie will be showing, (& he also Validated our parking!) restrooms were near and easy to find. We found our theater and claimed our row of seats and with plenty of time we elected a "snack team" to get popcorn etc. (at one of two large snack bars!) I thought to myself...for the amount of traffic The Maya Cinemas sure keeps a clean building inside & out! The subdued lighting gave a dramatic feel as you entered and finding seats was simple, the chairs were padded for extra comfort with the pull down arm rest and cup holder. The giant screen prior to the movie reminded us of the use of cell phones & texting (now that is highly appreciated!) Our "snack Team" returned with a cargo of goodies and row call was made, everyone present & counted for! The lights dimmed & the excellent Sony Surround Sound System took over as we all watched with eyes wide open in wait of the excitement to come....I love this place! When the movie was over the clean up teams were there at the entrance and very courteous and professional Every seemed to be talking about a character or exciting scene. As we walked out of the Maya our eyes were greeted with the clean, new Taylor Farms building and as we walked towards the Steinbeck Center I was inspired by the class and culture Salinas has.....who said we didn't build it?

data.title: Huge Centrally Located Cinema Complex
data.text: This theater will tend to have an impressive selection of current mainstream hit movies. It rarely has "art" films, political films or anything not commercially successful.  But, the cinemas are very comfortable and location is great, right  in the heart of Oldtown Salinas, near the Steinbeck Center and several restaurants and bars.

data.title: South Salinas Cinema
data.text: I have never been dissatisfied with my movie experience at Maya.  Always clean and on time.  Parking is always available in the garage and I have always felt safe.  For the foodies, there are many eating opportunities close by.

data.title: Very nice theatre
data.text: Clean, comfortable and affordable. The only place to go when we go out to the movies. There are also good eateries with walking distance and the Stieinbecl center is right down the street.

data.title: Go here often
data.text: This is my main movie theatre of choice when I do go to the movies.  I prefer to watch movies at home because of how expensive going to the movies has become over the years but when we do go out, this is where we go.  Theatre's are all clean, lines are not too long for snacks and they valid 3 hours of parking in the nearby parking garage which is wonderful!

data.title: Good Movie Theater
data.text: The Maya is a good theater, it has been clean every time I have gone, no sticky floor even on a Friday night. Love the self serve butter and the bathrooms are also clean. Seats are comfortable and there are enough theaters that it is rarely full.

data.title: My Movie Place
data.text:
Very nice clean theatre with great location---Close to home and I can walk.  Tuesday is family day and tickets are less--I think $5.50 each.   Senior day is Wednesday and only $4.  I really like going in the afternoons when you are most likely to have the  theatre almost all to yourself.  The staff is friendly.  There is a small arcade.  You can have your kid's birthday party here too and set up in the snack area where there are plenty of tables and chairs. They have a place to store the cake and party goodies.  
The snack bar prices are outrageous so be prepared.   Free parking in the nearby parking structure with maya validation.

data.title: BEST VALUE IN THE AREA
data.text: My wife and I go there every Wednesday for Senior's Day. This special includes $4 entrance and $4 Senior combo. Very friendly staff.

data.title: Senior Special Wednesdays
data.text: Not only $4 movies, but Wednesday Senior Special snack pack with popcorn, drink and candy snack  for $4.  Often shows movies not shown at other cinema in town. Validated 3 hr parking at public lot adjacent to Steinbeck National Center.

data.title: Wednesday is Senior Citizen $4.00 tickets day and evening
data.text: I happened to go to see The Martian at the Maya Cinemas in Salinas last night.  My friend was very happy and surprised to pay only $4.00 for a 6:35 pm showing.  The movie theatre is large, bright and clean.  The parking garage behind the theatre validates.  I took a walk down the street before the show.  There are several interesting restaurants and shops.

data.title: Wonderful Cinema
data.text: Wonderful Cinema,  I am from Marina therfore I always went to the Monterey Cinemas.  I absolutely love this one.  The seats  and individual venues in there are beautiful and clean

data.title: Decent theater
data.text: Maya is a decent theater, one thing I don't like is their popcorn, and I don't like the fact that they don't layer the butter as they are filling it (like the other big theater in town does...).  The quality of their movies is pretty good, however on more than once occasion we've had issues where they had to rewind the movie, and once when the movie melted and we had to get a refund.

data.title: Great Theater in Old Town !
data.text: I am sold ! Totally faithful to this theater, I don't like the theater that's near the mall, it is the one that seems unsafe, Not the Maya. There's a handy parking garage, and if you get your stub stamped from the Maya, parking is free for about 2 hours. We go here very often, there are some homeless people here and there, but I've never had a problem, the Maya is clean and well taken care of, it's such a great location because it's so close to a variety of restaurants, and very good one's at that !

data.title: Feels unsafe
data.text:
We don't have a lot of choices in Salinas if we want to see a movie.  Maya is close and convenient for South Salinas residents.  However, parking is an issue, and my children are afraid to walk from the parking garage to the theater because of the current homeless issue in our town.  We have been approached by some of the downtrodden or mentally ill on almost every occasion.  Not Maya's fault, but just a fact of where it is situated.

Theater is not the cleanest.  Often sticky floors, etc.  Could be better.

data.title: Movies in Salinas
data.text: This movie theater is located in the heart of downtown Salinas. It's within walking distance of several restaurants and bars and has garage parking which can be validated in the theater. It's a smaller theater but it's easy to get to. However, depending on the movie release, the parking garage could be challenging when it comes to parking.
